sentence: rapid growth can place considerable pressure on, among other areas, an organization's management information systems, change-management controls, strategic planning, credit concentrations, and asset/liability management.
on the other hand, regulations that are enacted for broader societal purposes, but that the enterprise sees as of little benefit to its revenue growth, can be viewed as an expensive mandate.
it also illustrates that in new lines of business, sometimes erm must go outside the enterprise and work with competitors to support the growth of shared systems and standards to mitigate risks.
